data.title: Not family entertainment
data.text: From the ads one might think Summer Mummers is for everyone. Just be aware that it's geared toward adults--and is rowdy, bawdy, and messy. I wouldn't take the kids. Or my grandma. And I'm sometimes uncomfortable myself...

data.title: Hold onto Your Pants
data.text: Just thought it was a play, boy was we wrong. Part Play, Musical, Movie, Humor, Dancing and just plan hilarious. On top of that, you can go one weekend, then the next weekend and there will be new parts. Cast and crew did an outstanding job. Will be going again. Remember don't forget your popcorn.

data.title: Must see one of a kind show!
data.text: Have a drink,or a few and get ready for a great old time type play and following olio skits and performances that are  a unique gem. And get ready for Popcorn everywhere! On your head, and everywhere else. Where tight clothes and no jewelry! A one a kind experience, known world wide!

data.title: Good dirty adult fun
data.text: It's probably the best thing to do in Midland during the summers. It's just a hilarious good time for adults. Get a baby sitter and go! You have to buy tokens at a both to get beer at the bar and they give you beads if you tip. There is popcorn everywhere so the floors tend to get sticky so wear appropriate shoes and clothing that you don't mind getting buttery popcorn all over. In the balcony you can't throw popcorn so try and avoid those seats bc I think it takes away from the experience of having fun with complete strangers around you. Worth every penny. Beers a little pricey but totally worth it.

data.title: Always ridiculously fun
data.text: Summer Mummers is a must in Midland during the Summer. Silly over the top corny vaudeville production in the Historic Yucca Theatre. Throw buckets....bags.... Tubs of popcorn!  Laugh and let loose. Complete stupidity and complete fun. Don't wear any jewelry or clothes that you would die if something happened to them. Everything has a great chance of slipping off. Don't wear high heels either. The floor is super slick. This event is not for kids and not for senior adults either. Most suited for 21-50 age group. I have gone for 37 years!  Great stupid fun.

data.title: Extremely different
data.text: This had been recommended by friends so 10 off us went to see it. The price of the tickets were $20/$25 each, it's located in the centre of Midland in what looks like a rundown theatre, upon entering your directed to a booth were you buy tokens for beer or popcorn. I brought 2 tokens, one for a beer and the other for popcorn. The bags are large, once inside there are rows of tables and chairs. As soon as you go to sit down the popcorn throwing starts. Now I soon realised this wasn't for me as I'm not a food waster. By the intermission the floor was covered. I would strongly recommend trainers as items could get stuck in your toes and wear a collar T-Shirt. It was a dark venue and the humour wasn't for me. It was a slide show black/White to show a little build up but I got bored quickly. However the venue was packed. We brought our tickets 3 months in advance as it sells out the whole summer. Unfortunately I won't be going again

data.title: Outrageous Fun in The Permian Basin
data.text:
I was born and raised in Midland.  We moved to Dallas 15 years ago.  We have missed Summer Mummers ever since then.  We have been threatening to go back for the show - but it's just not as much fun with just 2 people.

Why?

Popcorn throwing madness!  It's a melodrama with bad guys and heroes.  Party girls and sidekicks.  Silent movies are woven in for story parts.  sometimes people forget their lines.  It is a riot!

This year, we said it was the year.  We grabbed 18 other friends and scored 20 tickets in the pit (just behind the orchestra) to watch the show.

The rules say to not throw popcorn.  Yeah right.  Just try to stop 300 beer crazed people that have been throwing popcorn for 64 years, from throwing popcorn.  It's not going to happen.

So, you go, you buy tokens for $5 each.  Then, you buy popcorn by the tray (4 tokens) or two.  Oh, and don't forget to buy a souvenir cup with a lid and straw.  Otherwise, your beverage will be salty and full of popcorn.

In the pit, after the show, the popcorn was at least 8 inches deep.

Leave your jewelry - all of it - at home or in the safe at your hotel.  Wear clothes you are comfortable in and that can withstand popcorn.  Wear closed toe, non-slip shoes.  Get ready to laugh yourself silly just because it is that much fun. 

You might not understand all of it - we rarely do.  But, the venue, the popcorn throwing fun, the laughter and the whole experience is pure joy.

If you haven't been to Summer Mummers, you haven't been to Midland.  Period.

data.title: Laugh, Laugh and more laughs
data.text: Summer Mummers is so funny and when you think you are done laughing here it comes again.  The people on stage are amazing to be there on that stage every weekend all summer long starting in June.  It is adult fun and if your are easily insulted or bothered by mild adult things then I don't suggest it.

data.title: Villains, heroes, popcorn and beer!
data.text: I've been going to Summer Mummers for 35 years and it never disappoints!  Boo and hiss at the villain, cheer for the hero, throw popcorn at your friends and the other audience members...I always have a good time!

data.title: Good times
data.text: Throw popcorn at the bad guy! Tons of laughs. Not recommended for kids. Lots of alcohol. Easy parking in parking lot. Clean restrooms. Cool theater.

data.title: It used to be great...
data.text: Now it's average. My favorite part of Mummers was the Olio.  It's changed so much in the last 2 years, I don't enjoy it as much as I once did.  It's almost all dance routines now, not skits, like it used to be.  I would love to see it go back to the way it once was!

data.title: Puts the fun Iin fundraising! !
data.text: A good way to have fun and laugh your butt off!   Same story different characters and locations but always funny!

data.title: Total Fun
data.text: This is a great event to take your family/friends too if you enjoy laughing a lot! Best advise I can give is don't wear a low cut blouse, you will say thanks later. Summer Mummers is open to all ages. Over all it's a blast!!!

data.title: Crazy Mummers
data.text: Worth a visit and great to take visitors in the summer. The format is the same each year with some current quips thrown in.

data.title: Fun Night
data.text: This is a great plythora of energy, comedy, and just good ole fun. Don't wear your jewelry or your pretty dress because it involves alot of popcorn.

data.title: Interesting once, but probably will not return.
data.text: Interesting place to go once just to see what it is all about, but not very funny.  The actors were difficult to understand even though the volume was loud enough. The whole popcorn throwing thing is just a little too much.

data.title: One of a kind
data.text: Summer Mummers is unique to Midland and a must see if you are in town.  Tons of fun and something you will never forget.

data.title: This year fell flat :(
data.text:
I have been attending Summer Mummer's every year since I moved to Midland in 2004. Let me start of by saying, if I would have written this review last year it would have gotten 5 stars. It's typical for the audience to be rowdy during the performance, but this year takes the cake. I witnessed 2 tables being kicked out by police (never seen that before). This year's Melodrama was NOT written well. The moviolas were way too long! And the audience's attention span was lost with-in the first scene. However, the intermissions and Olio were great fun!!! I was so disappointed with the melodrama this year, which is why I decided to write this review. By all means, I hope they pick a better story line/writer next year. 

For all those that have never experienced Summer Mummers. You boo at the villain's and cheer for the hero's and throw popcorn at anyone sitting around you at any opportune moment. Loads of fun!!!! Age recommended is 16 and up (I would strongly advise 18 and up). Oh! one more thing make sure you get a mug with a lid. Open cups are prime target for popcorn :)

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Really enjoyed the show. Loved the way the theater looked and the people were friendly. Never been anywhere where it was okay to throw popcorn. Very talented group. Only complaint was the chair I sat in. Too hard. 😉

data.title: Don't miss this fun!!
data.text:
There is no way to explain the fun and mayhem that is Summer Mummers!!! Where else can you watch a melodrama complete with hero and villain and throw popcorn at him??? 
It's the most fun you can have with your clothes on!! Just do it!!
